Title: Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission Tender Announcement
#
## Contract Opportunity Details
#
The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) invites qualified suppliers to provide professional services for a project titled "Review of the most current risk information related to exposure of embryos and fetuses to ionizing radiation." The project aims to compile and document up-to-date information on the risks to embryos and fetuses from in utero exposure to ionizing radiation, with a focus on reviewing and updating existing risk information.
#
### Project Scope
#
The scope of the project involves reviewing the risk information outlined in INFO-0700, "Dose Limits for Pregnant Workers," with the goal of confirming and updating the information to reflect current scientific understanding. The outcome of this review will be used for future regulatory analyses.
#
### Key Details
#
* **Contract Period**: One (1) year commencing on the contract award date
* **Evaluation Criteria**: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price
* **Language**: Bids may be submitted in either official language of Canada
* **Attachments**: The tender notice includes attachments with additional information and requirements.
#
### How to Participate
#
Interested suppliers must submit their proposals in accordance with the instructions in the Request for Proposal (RFP). In case of discrepancies between the English and French versions of the RFP, the English version will take precedence.
#
### Updates
#
To ensure timely access to updates and modifications, suppliers are advised to click on the "Follow this Notice" link and subscribe to the notification method of their choice.
